name: TheAtlantic
text: Last January, the incoming White House chief of staff warned that Donald Trump wasn’t ready to handle the looming coronavirus outbreak. @JeffreyGoldberg caught up with Klain to discuss how he knew things would go so awry: https://t.co/iILDlUXCTg

name: TheAtlantic
text: Join us Thursday at 11:00 a.m. EST for a virtual forum exploring what it takes to create a White House team and set a new course for national policy and politics: https://t.co/wusMdPMvTV

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @zeynep: Did you try and fail to to convince your elderly relatives to avoid holiday gatherings? I have a suggestion. Propose waiting until March. Things are grim now so it's a horrid time to get sick but the US could experience a dramatic turnaround. Hope is real. https://t.co/pWVty1QNTA https://t.co/RE8QhETaDd

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "[T]his Christmas will be a particularly terrible time to catch the coronavirus. Hospitals nationwide are already overwhelmed, ICUs stretched to their limit...."  
Read this  warning  from @zeynep:

https://t.co/YHFRkkqHvf

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "[I]t’s hard not to focus on the political failures that led us to a third surge. But when people look back on this period, decades from now, they will also tell stories, both good and bad, about this extraordinary moment for science...." 
Read @edyong209:
https://t.co/nhjgTp5Kwx

name: TheAtlantic
text: As a kid, Martellus Bennett felt the weight of the pernicious idea that a Black boy who can’t play ball will end up either dead or in jail, @hbryant42 writes. The former NFL player, now a children’s-book author, wants these boys to see a different path. https://t.co/hL25NJMHQc

name: TheAtlantic
text: Helmeted hornbills are enormous birds—measuring almost six feet from beak to tail—and the tree cavities they prefer to nest in are in short supply, writes @yaohualaw: https://t.co/crW8TnSmi6

name: TheAtlantic
text: There may be a good amount of hidden unhappiness around the holidays, even in the merriest of years. And this is a year that will be especially trying. @arthurbrooks has advice for making a sad holiday season a little merrier: https://t.co/Hz1MbvULoj

name: TheAtlantic
text: Reporting that ties adverse events to the vaccines can backfire, @BrendanNyhan argues. Media outlets should focus on scientific studies of the vaccines at scale, and avoid amplifying misleading anecdotes. https://t.co/NK5gy3JEJh

name: TheAtlantic
text: Watch: Atlantic Senior Editor Ron Brownstein interviews former Obama cabinet officials Janet Napolitano and Syliva Matthews-Burwell about what we can learn from past presidential transitions. https://t.co/1ZduBqtiBf

name: TheAtlantic
text: Watch: Atlantic staff writer @IsaacDovere interviews U.S. House Majority Whip James E. Clyburn about how President-elect Joe Biden should lead. https://t.co/ryRu5VLJTw

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "Christmas? I am content to celebrate it as a religious observance, but the secular aspects feel socially coercive and commercially predatory. My feelings are complicated, to say the least." -- @arthurbrooks:
https://t.co/9egNVYibNp

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @YAppelbaum: You don’t have to put life on hold forever—but we do need to make it through this very dark winter, first. So a word of advice from @zeynep, as you contemplate holiday gatherings: Hang on for three more months

https://t.co/bRFKEkRwev

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @julieebeck: come for the photo of young @arthurbrooks hating Christmas, stay for some good advice: https://t.co/ZKwL6kmTyw

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @RonBrownstein: The dissonance inJoe Biden’s victory speech this week encapsulates a central strategic challenge he’ll face as president: is the radicalized GOP he described in the speech's 1st half open to the cooperation he promised in its 2nd? My take https://t.co/DZtasftu2f

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @elainejgodfrey: This is the first Christmas of my life that I won't get to be with my parents. I am really sad about this, and I know the next few weeks will feel weird. But I'm also hopeful that we'll be together soon:

https://t.co/NO2hfM5bcw

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @skornhaber: Thank you to Grimes, Rina Sawayama, Bonny Light Horseman, Flo Milli, Andy Shauf, Haim, and the rest of the bunch for the incredible albums.

Thank you to James Parker for "plangencies" and Hannah Giorgis for a sneaky Mariah Carey joke!

https://t.co/QRX97XDzmB

name: TheAtlantic
text: SPONSORED: The routes winding across Western Massachusetts offer drivers scenic views of New England, as well as evidence of American history. https://t.co/2K40DQFPfh @Toyota https://t.co/XaBxDWY0tk

name: TheAtlantic
text: “I have a simple suggestion for anyone contemplating a large gathering this month,” @zeynep writes. “Wait until March.” https://t.co/L0AdZBBDWQ

name: TheAtlantic
text: Joe Biden insists he can work with Republicans. How many other Democrats—including his vice president—feel the same way? @RonBrownstein reports. https://t.co/Zk6VNPQxRW

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Everybody was shocked to see how quickly things changed." Listen to @TheAtlantic's episode of "Social Distance" about Americans going hungry during the pandemic: https://t.co/cmu7yygpyk

name: TheAtlantic
text: For late-night-comedy writers, covering Trump often meant deciding whether to give him airtime at all. A Biden administration removes that burden, but presents a fresh set of challenges for the crowded genre, reports @shirklesxp: https://t.co/TjUSmShVM3

name: TheAtlantic
text: In twelve states, including New Jersey, Texas, and Arizona, COVID-19 hospitalization have surpassed 300 people per million for the second time this year, @whet reports. https://t.co/E2pRA1bBEl

name: TheAtlantic
text: SPONSORED: Everyone needs to get outside sometimes—including John Mayer. A few months ago, we sent him to Jedediah Smith Redwoods State Park in his favorite vehicle: the new @LandroverUSA Defender 110. See the full journey here: https://t.co/ptXnpkwGeP https://t.co/dgpzZmgpv0

name: TheAtlantic
text: Facebook has rolled back a post-election algorithm shift that favored authoritative news outlets. “The cycle of harm perpetuated by Facebook’s scale-at-any-cost business model is plain to see,” writes @AdrienneLaF. https://t.co/b8JNtITDmx

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Settling on a show that ran for seven full seasons (or 40) eased decision fatigue and guaranteed at least a few weeks of blissful simplicity." Hannah Giorgis on the appeal of watching 'The Sopranos,' 'Survivor,' and other time-consuming TV shows in 2020: https://t.co/e1tksRL8T5

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: "In the first few months of the pandemic, the virus came in waves, rising in one place, falling in another. Now it’s rising almost everywhere." https://t.co/C7jp6MpmYq

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "I knew Dr. Fauci well enough to know that he was going to tell the truth and speak out and that sooner or later that would run afoul of the Trump approach to governance.” -- @RonaldKlain: 
https://t.co/GaI5tCcz3B

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @marinakoren: Day 17 of the Hubble advent calendar: A galaxy merger, a process that unfolds over hundreds of millions of years. In this pic, stars from one galaxy are already falling into the other. https://t.co/ncW6cxSof5 https://t.co/h0Ugjdd5fK

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @realcpaz: From @TheAtlantic's culture team on @taylorswift13's #Folklore:

"This extraordinary artist/shape-shifter seemed to have cracked some kind of genetic code for profound pastoral pop...'#Epiphany' is shattering."

https://t.co/JUxOPwTwjt

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JohnGHendy: "The United States is hoping to vaccinate 50 million people by the end of January, and the actual number vaccinated this winter could be even higher." 

Some end-of-year optimism from @zeynep https://t.co/n15lbp2j8d

name: TheAtlantic
text:
An FDA advisory panel endorsed Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine —making it the second to receive such backing in the U.S. But, as @Sarahzhang reported last week, we're entering a confusing period, in which certain groups get vaccinated while others have to wait.
https://t.co/Jw4aTcHxan

name: TheAtlantic
text: In just one day this past week, states and territories reported 3,400 COVID-19 deaths, 24 percent more than were reported on the worst day of the spring surge, @COVID19Tracking writes: https://t.co/YFS9tUN95I
